title.value: Kernel Panic (might be caused by defect memory/RAM )

body.value:
If the computer crashes often during boot process it might be caused by defect RAM (of cause there might be other reasons, too).
To check RAM (memory modules):
boot, press SHIFT at the same time,
the GRUB menu shows up, click on Memtest86 (Memory test),
defect memory parts will be listed and marked red,
Important: To find out, which part of the memory is defect you have to check each RAM element. Remove the others. Sometimes the error only shows up at a certain RAM plug-in space...
